### **The role**


 At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.


 We are looking for an experienced Senior business intelligence analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants) and levels of seniority. Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.


 You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.


### **What you'll be doing**


* Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
* Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
* Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
* Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Data Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
* Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries


### **Requirements**


* Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
* A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
* Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
* Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
* Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)
* Understanding of another coding language (Python/R)


**Why Deliveroo**


 Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.


 We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.


 **Workplace & Benefits**


 At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.


 **Diversity**


 At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.


 We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. **Who are we?**


 Whatfix is a data-driven digital adoption platform (DAP) that enables organizations and users to maximize the benefits of software. Whatfix acts as an interactive overlay on top of any application to guide users with real-time guidance, self-help support, and user feedback. With product analytics and AI, Whatfix enables scalable success with technology, maximizing productivity, and leveraging data-driven insights for better decision-making. The company has seven offices globally in the US, India, UK, Germany, Singapore, and Australia, and works with Fortune 500 companies around the world. Whatfix has raised $140 million to date and is backed by marquee investors including Softbank, Sequoia, Dragoneer, and Cisco Investments.


 **“Hustle Mode ON” is the motto we live by.**


* Whatfix has been named among the top 20 B2B tech companies like Adobe, PayPal, and Cisco.
* With YoY revenue growth of over 65%, we have also been recognized among the top 20 fastest-growing SaaS companies worldwide in the SaaS 1000 list.
* Recognized by Forrester and Everest Group as a 'Leader' in the digital adoption space, and listed by LinkedIn among one of the Top 5 startups in India in 2020
* Listed in Deloitte Technology Fast 500™ among fastest-growing companies in North America for 2022 and 2021 and recognized as Great Place to Work 2022-2023
* Our Customer centricity is evident from a Customer rating of 4.67 on G2 Crowd & 4.7 on Gartner Peer Insights


**We are looking for a stellar Analyst to come on board.**


 The Product Analytics & Insights team bridges the operational and product sides of Whatfix, using a strategic mindset, and analytical thinking to drive “data” driven business decisions. The Sr. Data analyst in this role will work with large amounts of complex data to draw actionable insights not only for the product team but also for adjacent teams that need deep product usage insights.


 **What will you get to do?**


* Analyze complex product problems using data from customer product usage data
* Provide actionable insights to decision-makers to influence strategy and product roadmap
* Build and maintain usage & operational dashboard for both executive leadership and other stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends
* Closely work with Data Lake & Product teams to ingest required data sets and set up data pipelines to efficiently run analytics & modeling projects
* Co-own the business goals & lead data-led problem solving to find actionable insights across multiple product areas to drive customer engagement and product adoption
* Collaborate with R&D to ensure and improve data availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliability
* Own product data from tracking and modeling through visualization and analysis
* Provide mentorship, guidance and training to associates/interns


**Our Ideal Candidate**


* 3-5 years of experience and a strong analytical background, with a degree (preferred from tier 1/2 college) in computer science, engineering, statistics or related quantitative field
* SQL and Python/R/Julia/Scala proficiency - a must
* Ability to turn large amounts of ambiguous data into a concise, meaningful story
* Ability to understand user behaviour and meaning behind the numbers
* Experience working with BI / Web Analytics tools - Looker/Tableau/Qliksense/Sisense etc
* Experience working in a Product(B2B) set-up - SaaS set up an advantage
* Understanding of concepts in quantitative user behaviour analysis - segmentation, trends, cohort
* Experience with delivering analytics recommendations to senior leadership and executive-level audiences
* Attention to detail combined with creative thinking
* Good to have experience in AI/ML, data science, NLP/Text analytics, Gen AI
* Good to have experience using Product Analytics tools such as Amplitude, Mixpanel etc.,


**Perks & Benefits (India) #LI-Onsite**


* Best-in-class medical insurance coverage
* Free lunch & dinner buffet
* Doorstep cab drop facility
* Education Sponsorship
* Internal job transfer & global mobility programs
* Scope to represent Whatfix at global events
* We also provide uncapped incentives, bonus plans and opportunities to employees (especially those in GTM teams) to travel to meet our global customers


**Note:**


* *We strive to live and breathe our Cultural Principles and encourage employees to demonstrate some of these core values - Customer First; Empathy; Transparency; Fail Fast & Scale Fast; No Hierarchies for Communication; Deep Dive & Innovate; Trust, Do it as you own it;*

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status*

 Process, Project & Data Management

* Champion One Team attitude


 DESIRED REQUIREMENTS

We are seeking a Partner Data Integration and Business Intelligence (BI) Manager to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, maintaining, and optimizing partner data pipelines, ensuring seamless integration, transformation, and storage of critical data for analysis and decision support.


 As the Partner Data Integration and BI Manager, you will play a vital role in the data management process, ensuring that partner campaign performance data is efficiently ingested, transformed, and integrated for business intelligence and reporting purposes. Your work will involve close collaboration with engineering, data science, analytics and media teams to streamline data processes and empower data-driven decision-making.


 **Core Responsibilities** 


**Data Ingestion:**


* Integrate partner campaign performance data from diverse sources, including APIs, custom scripts, and data connectors.
* Establish and maintain reliable data ingestion processes to ensure a seamless flow of information.


 **Data Transformation:**


* Clean, preprocess, and transform raw data into a format suitable for analysis and reporting.
* Address data quality issues, missing values, and normalize data as needed.


 **Data Integration:**


* Combine data from various sources to create comprehensive datasets.
* Merge data on key identifiers, such as campaign IDs, dates, or user information, to enable cross-source analysis.


 **Performance Optimization:**


* Continuously monitor data pipelines for efficiency and performance.
* Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, ensuring timely data processing.


 **Database and Warehouse Management:**


* Manage and maintain databases and data warehouses for storing processed data.
* Ensure data is stored securely and is accessible for BI and analytical purposes.


 **Documentation and Reporting:**


* Maintain detailed documentation of data integration processes and changes.
* Generate reports and insights from integrated data to support business decision-making.


 **Collaboration:**


 Collaborate with cross-functional teams and internal stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.


 **Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (Master's degree a plus).
* 5+ of experience in data integration, data engineering, or business intelligence with focus on digital media.
* Proficiency in data transformation and ETL processes.
* Strong knowledge of database management systems and data warehousing.
* Experience working with APIs, data connectors, and scripting languages.
* Excellent problem-solving and performance optimization skills.
* Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
* Must have substantial experience with BI and data visualization tools within the digital media data context.

### **Minimum qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or another quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 4 years of experience in financial planning and analysis (FP&A), consulting, a related function, or an advanced degree.


  

### **Preferred qualifications:**


* Experience in an environment including, but not limited to, financial planning and analysis, business analytics, management consulting, or investment banking.
* Experience partnering with executive leadership and driving impact.
* Excellent business judgment, leadership skills, with the ability to communicate with clarity and engage with a executive management team.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to manage ambiguous problems and drive insights.
* Excellent technical (e.g., Financial Modeling, SQL, Data Visualization) skills working with large volumes of complex data.



**About the job**
-----------------


 Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. Working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to take on big picture challenges.  
   
 As someone who knows the workings of the core Finance team inside and out, you'll lead individual projects to transform planning, tracking and control processes. You'll provide senior level management with insightful recommendations, planning and reporting support.


 Business Finance is part of Google’s Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) organization, providing financial support to Google’s business organization. Our work is integral to the strategic decision-making and operations of the commercial teams across all our advertising products.   
   
 The Google Customer Solutions (GCS) Finance team partners with business and cross-functional leadership to provide problem solving insights and recommendations on key business decisions. We are responsible for core operations such as forecasting and budgeting, and act as a trusted advisor to the leadership team on topics such as business performance, risks and opportunities, market acceleration plans, and resource allocation.  
   
 As Business Finance Analyst for the AppDev, GCS team you will partner with the Global AppDev (GCS) Leadership to build the future of the App Developers digital ecosystem. You will drive projects and initiatives for FP&A and support large, cross-functional, complex projects, and initiatives. Your work will involve partnering with others in finance, business, business operations and strategy in country, regional, and global teams.


 The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.




**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Drive business strategy across the AppDev Business. Define financial analysis objectives and needs for your area of the business, and effectively prioritize activities.
* Act as a Trusted advisor to business leaders on business performance and finance related priorities. Provide management with clear insights and recommendations and interact regularly to drive business enhancing product actions.
* Lead investigative deep dives independently in partnership with finance and cross-functional partners, bring clarity to the biggest and most complex problems.
* Communicate effectively by clearly and confidently conveying a message by simplifying technical complexity behind solutions/calculations, and focusing on actionable insights.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Business Finance Analyst



  
 We are seeking a solid, self-starting finance professional to partner with business teams, who will be enabling decisions for growing existing businesses and building new ones from scratch at Flipkart. This role is more than finance: it requires ability to invent, go beyond the standard business rules to “experiment” and “conceive” together with the business partners- financial sustainable solution.



  
 The Business Finance team partners with the business team to drive growth sustainably. The team drives efficiency in the investment being made to drive topline and customer metrics. Focus remains on improving category margins and minimizing financial risks by understanding the key business drivers, analyze key financial metrics, provide value add analysis, support to sales / finance management (budget analysis, portfolio management and financial forecasting


  
 Perform financial forecasting, reporting, and operational metrics tracking


* Analyze financial data – and create financial models for decision support
* Increase productivity by developing automated reporting/forecasting tools
* Mentor the team and ensure learning curve for their growth
* Ensure maintenance of Data archives for easy consumption whenever required
* Report on financial performance and prepare for regular leadership reviews
* Analyze past results, perform variance analysis, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements
* Work closely with the accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting and decision support
* Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts
* Provide analysis of trends and forecasts and recommend actions for optimization
* Recommend actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; study proposed changes in methods and materials.
* Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and Excel dashboards.




 **The successful candidate should have a history of:**


* Delivering high quality financial control,
* Business partnering with Category team to prepare roadmap for sustainable growth,
* Driving cost optimization projects across teams to improve bottomline,
* Working on projects related to Working capital optimization and Inventory control
* Ability to model new and ambiguous businesses,
* Work in a constantly changing environment
* Motivated by a fast-paced and highly entrepreneurial environment.


 This is a perfect position for someone who knows how to work fast and smart. This person will work on multiple tasks, helping his/her business partners understand financial decisions and as the trusted business advisor. As a member of a growing team, you will deal with a high level of ambiguity and changing priorities. The successful candidate will manoeuvre through the ambiguity, communicate effectively across teams and levels, while balancing the needs and requirements of internal and external customers. Flexibility and the ability to prioritize in a changing business environment will also be key.

 **Job Description**
 **Role Description:**



  
 If you have a passion for analytics and a desire to leverage product data to shape the product roadmap, this role is for you. As a product analyst, you'll collaborate with Product & Engineering, along with a few cross-functional teams, to provide data-led decision-making support for the product. The ideal candidate should feel comfortable working with complex data, understand product implementation, confidently navigate ambiguity in business processes, and have hands-on experience in data analysis. Moreover, the ability to translate data into practical insights to assist Product Management with a strategic lens is essential. Familiarity with basic product metrics will be key.



 **NOTE:** This is an individual contributor role with a career path to grow into a SME.



* Take ownership of end-to-end product analytics autonomously.
* Act as a Product Owner to drive instrumentation goals, ensuring constant updating of product telemetry.
* Demonstrate the ability to comprehend complex data and product landscapes, and a willingness to navigate ambiguity, simplifying them for product management.
* Collaborate daily with Product Managers, Engineering, TPM, and Operations. Engage in cross-functional interactions with Marketing, Customer-facing teams, and senior leadership on product-centric, cross-functional business requests as needed.
* Apply strong database skills to extract insights from large, intricate datasets.
* Filter and refine unstructured (or ambiguous) data into usable datasets, which can be analyzed to extract insights and enhance business processes and product decisions.
* Extract value from existing analytics frameworks and step in to construct new ones as required by the business.
* Provide reports on product health and feature benchmarking. Identify optimization/at-risk areas for customers using product telemetry, incorporating a blend of heuristics and predictive models.
* Monitor product adoption KPIs and connect them with adjacent business data models to uncover expansion and retention opportunities.
* Communicate findings to stakeholders and spearhead initiatives aimed at improving business performance.


 **Requirements:**


* Sound knowledge of standard descriptive statistical techniques and proficiency in using predictive analytical models when necessary.
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to storyboard and present insights concisely.
* Hands-on experience with DBMS systems and proficiency in framing SQL queries for complex data manipulation. Expertise in creating and automating data workflows.
* Proficiency in Python and R for building predictive and exploratory analytical models.
* Ability to craft compelling narratives with data using appropriate visuals and hands-on experience in building and maintaining dashboards using tools such as Power BI, Looker, Tableau, Sisense, etc.
* Proven track record of collaborating with stakeholders and delivering analytics projects with measurable impact.
* Ability to act as a Product Owner, driving instrumentation and telemetry for new features.
* Experience with text mining, recommender systems, and social media analytics is an added advantage.


 **Qualifications**
  

* At least 5 years of hands-on work experience in analytics, with a minimum of 3 years of experience in product analytics.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in a customer-facing analytics role.

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.





**What you will do**
--------------------




 **Professional Data Analyst – Thermal Management**


  
 Are you ready to make electrifying connections? Help us to design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of the Volvo Group Vehicle Technology team, you’ll help us accelerate our journey by engineering exciting next-gen technologies with a global reach. Be part of our evolution as we strengthen our Data and Simulations team. Bring your love of numbers, statistics, mathematics, combined with domain knowledge in fluid and thermal sciences to drive the future development of thermal systems.



 **Your key responsibilities will include: -**


* As a Professional Data Analyst-Thermal in the Data Analytics and Machine Learning team, you will be responsible for understanding customer usage and performance of our products and for providing solutions throughout entire product life cycle including pre-, during- and post- development phases. You will make meaningful interpretations, recommendations and eventually predictions from the data available from various sources to support our endeavor in moving towards data driven development.
* Analyze data from test trucks/rig tests to provide quick feedback to the test engineers to ascertain the expected working of the thermal management systems in the trucks
* Develop intelligent dashboards that will help the test engineers to analyze the performance of the thermal system or indicate wrong readings in real time during tests
* Introduce real time interactive capabilities in the dashboards with automation functionalities for extraction of relevant data for various stakeholders
* Support the team to analyze big data from customer trucks to perform root cause analysis for customer product issues and provide a direction towards the solution
* Create, validate and implement advanced truck thermal systems utilization algorithms and its performance trend monitoring tools to enhance predictive maintenance forecasting accuracy
* Perform database queries to support engineering analysis and manage field issues
* Support implementation of dashboards and BI solutions for internal and external customer reporting
* Automating data pipelines and ioT pipelines that will lead to successful development and deployment of Digital Twins
* Work towards edge computing and other concepts to deploy data analytics and ML techniques onboard the trucks to make quick decisions


 Your role will strengthen our Global Thermal Management Sub-Stream and contribute to Volvo Group Trucks Technology vision within this technology area.



 **Your Future Team?**


 Thermal Management is a department within Vehicle Technology responsible for developing, delivering, and maintaining an optimized cab climate and vehicle cooling & heating systems for all types of propulsion installations to all truck brands within the Volvo Group. We are responsible for leading the work with strategies and advanced engineering globally. We are located at Gothenburg & Bengaluru, and we have close cooperation with the sites in Greensboro and Lyon. We understand the final customer needs and apply our knowledge to develop technical concepts and solutions that satisfy customer and business needs. The work is based on innovation, shared technology, common architecture, and brand uniqueness.






**Who are you?**
----------------




 To be successful in this role, we believe that you are a team player, high on energy, and are interested in working with global sites. You have an innovative and creative mindset to recommend engineering solutions and the willingness to learn and develop your own skills and abilities. In addition to this, you hold the below experience,



 **Mandatory Skills:**


* Bachelors/Masters in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Physics or equivalent with demonstrated experience of 5+ years in data analytics, machine learning, edge or cloud computing, ioT, etc.
* Advanced knowledge of heat transfer, thermodynamics, and fluid mechanics
* Ability to leverage analytical and quantitative skills to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, compare against physics-based models and complete root cause analysis
* Excellent exposure to tools like Python (including libraries like Numpy, SciPy, Pandas, Tensorflow), SQL, Git, Azure, Hadoop, Matlab/Simulink, pySpark
* A passion for turning data into knowledge with great visualizations using Power BI, QlikView, Tableau
* Experience in advanced ML/statistical techniques such as regression analysis, neural networks, (deep learning, RNN, LSTM, DQN etc.), time series forecasting techniques, classification, clustering, feature reduction etc. especially (but not mandatorily) in thermal management applications
* Experience/Knowledge in future technologies (e-MOB, Fuel Cell, H2 technologies)
* Good in compiling and presenting information verbally and in writing.



 **Merit Skills:**


* Experience in 1D/3D CFD simulations and/or testing of vehicle thermal management area
* Objected Oriented Programming in C/C++, APIs,

**JOB DESCRIPTION**
  
 You are a strategic thinker passionate about driving solutions in **quant analytics**. You have found the right team.


 As a Quant Analytics Professional within the Consumer and Community Banking (CCB) Finance team, you will be responsible for defining, refining, and achieving the set goals for our firm. Your role will involve promoting the analytical book of work during the development of the Price Elasticity & Optimization product for consumer lending products in the CCB treasury. You will support various lines of business, including home lending, retail banking, auto finance, and business banking. Your responsibilities will also include strategic thinking, presenting to executive stakeholders, and ensuring engineering teams meet overarching delivery goals. This role does not involve model development, but rather working closely with the modeling, data, business, and tech teams in delivering analytical solutions, conducting deep dives, assessing whether the model in development meets business requirements, back-testing, and more.


 **Job Responsibilities**


* Lay out the modeling requirements for the pricing elasticity of lending & deposits products including mortgage, auto, card, business banking, wealth management etc.
* Work closely with business modeling team to build sound pricing elasticity models.
* Analyze model inputs and model outputs to facilitate model development and model deployment.
* Partner with business teams to apply the model output to business strategies.
* Conduct in-depth analysis to help management understand the business impact of pricing strategies.
* Partner effectively with finance, modelling, data & technology, and business teams
* Present results and recommendations clearly and concisely


 **Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills.**


* Post-Graduation degree in a quantitative discipline; Math, Finance, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent work/training is required.
* 6+ years of technical delivery experience with a demonstrated track record of growing responsibility.
* Banking experience in one or more US consumer credit portfolios (i.e., U.S. Mortgage, Home Equity, Credit Card, Automotive, Lease, Business Banking)
* Knowledge of the Finance process especially Pricing, and macroeconomics
* Strong technical and statistical skills. Ability to synthesize data and communicate to leadership in a concise and effective manner, both verbally and written
* Focused attention to detail, analytical & inquisitive with high standards for quality and accuracy
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint). Experience in using Data extraction and Data analysis tools like SQL/R/Python


 **Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills**


* Knowledge of working in public cloud AWS will be an added advantage.
* History of effective multi-tasking, expectation setting, and escalation of issues, where appropriate
 Project Management Skills 
 * - well-organized, structured approach. Ability to achieve tight timelines on complex deliverables. Ability to manage and prioritize projects across cross-functional groups.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, ability to interact with individuals across departments / functions and with senior level individuals.
* Able to work effectively under pressure and in a rapidly changing environment to meet deadlines.
* Exhibited leadership and desire to oversee the development of credit analysts in the team. Experience in retail finance or Credit card finance within a bank a big plus

 **ABOUT US**

  

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  
   
 We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.



  

  

  
 **ABOUT THE TEAM**
  


 Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.
 

  

  



 The CCB Data & Analytics team responsibly leverages data across Chase to build competitive advantages for the businesses while providing value and protection for customers. The team encompasses a variety of disciplines from data governance and strategy to reporting, data science and machine learning. We have a strong partnership with Technology, which provides cutting edge data and analytics infrastructure. The team powers Chase with insights to create the best customer and business outcomes.

 Amazon.com operates in a virtual, global e-commerce environment without boundaries, and operates a diverse set of businesses worldwide, including Retail, third party marketplaces, e-commerce platforms, web services for developers. Amazon’s global price perception is how the population perceives Amazon’s pricing compared to other retailers. Elements that make up customer price perception include the perceived; (1) competitiveness of the retailers pricing (i.e. who has the perceived lowest prices), (2) clarity of price information on the site, (3) the price vs quality of the products offered (i.e. the value), (4) the price the customer expects to pay for the product at a given retailer, and (5) how Amazon messages pricing in press and advertising. 
  
CMT owns pricing to drive customer's price perception and competitiveness of Amazon products. We also support programs that drive excellence across tech/product teams that own the systems aiding promotions experience. We are seeking a creative and goal-oriented Business Analyst to join our Team to support our data driven decision making.

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.


 **About ExcelHer program:**  
 Are you looking for an opportunity to restart your career?  
 Do you want to work with an organization that would value your experience no matter when you gained them?  
 How about working with the best minds in the transportation industry where we need more women power?  
   
 We are pleased to launch the ExcelHer program – the career returnship program at Volvo Group in India. The program is for women who have been on a career break for a year or more. This is our step towards empowering women to relaunch their professional journey after their absence from the workplace due to personal commitments. Exciting work assignments have been identified which you can refer in the list below.  
   
 The assignments are for a tenure of 9 months. The participant of this program would have access to professional development programs, mentoring assistance by a business leader, apart from the experience of working with people from different functions/technologies/culture.  
   
 Go ahead and apply if you find the opportunities in line with your experience and career interest.



 **Candidate Profile for Tester + BA :**



 **BA :** 


* Background in Solution Management, Business Analysis
* 5+ Years of Experience in IT Operations
* Awareness of SMD, Agile concepts
* Good knowledge of Product Development in Automobile domain
* Motivated to take up ambitious digitization and modernization journey
* Works closely with both Business and IT operations team.
* Focussed on customer success and striving for quality delivery.


 **QA :**


 **Skills related to manual testing:**


* Understanding the techniques for manual testing such as regression, exploratory, ad hoc and performance testing
* Awareness about agile methodology
* At least basic knowledge about web apps
* Familiarity with tools such as Postman, Swagger, Confluence, Azure Devops
* Azure Test Management (Test Parameters)
* Selenium WebDriver / Playwright
* Azure Dependencies
* Automation framework/knowledge would be added advantage


  
 


**Expectation in terms of activities to handle for BA**


  


* Work with BSPM, DM, ITA on drawing roadmap on short and long term roadmap - Digitization, Modernization journey – Example Cloud journey, Micro services implementation, Data Analysis capabilities
* Work with Business, Team – Prepare use cases for Data analytical capabilities
* Business functionalities evolution to match new agile wow
* Work with Team to plan and include technical evolution activities in roadmap
* Run KU meetings, collect requirements, add backlog items, detail backlog with requirements, work with team on acceptance criterion
* Present requirements to team, collect work estimates, secure budget from BSPM, keep stakeholders informed on progress of items.
* Work with team on evolution of PowerBI Reports, bringing more analytical capabilities, value out of data from application
* Regular connect with BSPM, DM, Team on progress of delivery topics - Ex. Split key, Usage analysis etc.
* Help IT team in solving support cases as needed.
* Implement automation capabilities wherever needed to reduce time and effort spent on IT and business activities.



 **Expectation in terms of activities to handle in the area of test management**


  


* Review test documentation like test plan, test report etc.
* Participate in root cause analysis (RCA) and help team to identify corrective & preventive actions
* Define test metrics in project and do the test reporting thru the defined test metrics
* Cooperate with business representative and IT management to specify and agree on the scope of testing
* Participate in building good business relationship
* Recommend release changes with respect to time, scope, etc. to the IT if necessary (based on the product quality and business value)
* Measure test efficiency and finding ways to improve
* Co-ordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) / end to end (E2E) test in project
 Mentor or deliver training in the test management area

Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. 


We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together. 


**Role description:** ARCADIS is looking for talented individuals from India’s global IT capitals to help lead our surge into digital. We are transforming our own operations and those of our clients, analytics and digital is at the core of this transformation. 


Our analytics team works in a number of areas, supporting our key clients globally as well as transforming internal processes. We deliver predictive analytics as a service. We implement data-base and data-hosting solutions. We develop platforms for our clients and our teams to access and interact with their data. We create the right data architecture to achieve the best possible insights. Our clients also love the insights we provide through our dashboarding solutions. 


We are now recruiting talented individuals to fill our current vacancy for Senior Consultant – Power BI Lead to work on our projects in Bangalore. 


**Role accountabilities:** 


Experience in developing, maintaining, publishing and supporting dashboards using Power BI. 


* Have good Experience in SSAS tabular model and DAX, sound knowledge in partitions, processing optimizations.


* Experience in implementing static, dynamic row level security both in Power BI & SSAS Tabular model.


* Expertise in R powered Power BI visuals and custom visuals would be an added advantage.


* Expertise in bringing BIM models into Power BI would be an added advantage.


* Strong experience in publishing dashboards to Power BI service, using Power BI gateways, Power BI Report Server & Power BI Embedded.


* Very strong on database concepts, data modelling, stored procedures, complex query writing, performance optimization of SQL queries.


* Experience in Analytics (diagnostic, predictive & prescriptive), data architecture, big data, database


* Experience in manipulating, transforming, and analysing data sets that are large and complex.


* Experience across a range of digital technologies.


* Experience of data architecture and big data / databases.


* Incorporates, integrates, and interfaces technical knowledge with business / systems requirements.


* Understanding of all aspects of an implementation project including, but not limited to planning, analysis and design, configuration, development, conversions, system testing, cutover and production support.


* Produce written deliverables for requirement specifications and support documentation: process mapping, meeting minutes, glossaries, data dictionary, technical design, system testing and implementation activities.


* Collect and organize data, data warehouse reports, spreadsheets and databases for analytical reporting.


* Troubleshoot issues in reports related to data and investigate data issues in source systems.


**Key competencies / Values:** 


* Client focus – differentiating through tailored skills and depth of client understanding


* Excellence – striving for excellence, recognising that excellence is defined by our clients


* Trust – building and retaining relationships of trust with our clients, colleagues and business partners


* Teamwork – working together as a team for the Group, not just the individual


* Responsibility – taking responsibility for our performance and our safety


* People - we create the environment for people to realise their potential


**Qualifications & Experience:** 


* Bachelors or Masters degree in Engineering/Computer Science/Math/Statistics or related discipline


* Experience required: 7-10 years


* Exceptional organizational, communication, and time management skills


**Required Competencies;** 


* Strong abilities in analytics, statistics and scripting


* Knowledge of robotic process automation and web/sharepoint/platform development is highly desirable


* Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development.


* Experience in R, Python, Power-BI, Tableau, Click, SQL, RDBMS, NoSQL, UIPath or other RPA software, C#, .Net, Java


* Skills in dashboarding, scripting (R, Python) and databases are fundamental.


* Interest in Robotic Process Automation and other programming languages is highly desirable.


* Experience in basic statistical methodology: e.g. clustering and testing, predictive modelling (e.g. decision trees, regressions)


* Knowledge of, machine learning would also be beneficial, but not essential.


* Ability to communicate your analysis with clarity and precision. An ideal candidate would have a strong grasp of both technical and business perspectives.


* Hands-on experience building data dashboards using BI viz. Tableau, Power BI, D3.js or any


* Experience in cloud platforms, preferably Azure (Data Factory, Data Bricks)


* Effective at communicating verbally and through documentation to technical colleagues.


* Effective at communicating with stakeholders across the business, from executive briefings to end user training.


* Expertise in working in an Agile (Scrum) environment.


* Strong experience in SQL,-SQL Server, PostgreSQL etc.


* Experience building mathematical models in Excel, Python, R, or Matlab.



**Why Arcadis?** 


We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together. 


You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you. 


Together, we can create a lasting legacy. 


**Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging** 


We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day, which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. 


**Join Arcadis. Create a legacy** 


#JoinArcadis 


#CreateALegacy 


#Hybrid

**Job Description**


 Supply Chain Logistic Finance team is seeking a motivated and skilled financial professional to support APJ markets.


 In Logistic Finance role, you will be responsible for planning and managing costs incurred during product movement from factory to the end customer and work with operations and market finance to provide related support. Logistics involve a variety of different process and cost types such as logistics, duties, warehousing.


 This is a great opportunity to understand HP global logistics network, get to know Freight Forwarders Worldwide and follow macroeconomic trends for freight market. If you are curious how the product is delivered to the customers door, apply and join us!


 As a **Logistics Financial Analyst**, you will be responsible for:


 Providing complex financial analysis for logistics costs to support and influence decision making


 Ensuring completion of close activities and building story behind the numbers


 Short term and mid-term planning


 Acting as trusted partner and advisor on financial risks and opportunities while working closely with Logistic Operation Team


 Ensure close engagement with market finance in the area of Logistic costs


 Keeping close collaboration with Market Finance and Logistic Operations


 Identifying opportunities for process improvement and policy development


 Who are we looking for? 


A finance professional with:


 Learn – Work – Lead attitude


 Analytical mindset, proactive in developing ideas to improve processes/solve problems


 Independent and results oriented


 Excellent teamwork skills, including the ability to work effectively cross-functionally and cross-department


 Strong analytical and business application skills (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Power BI)


 Ability to provide conclusion and recommendations based on data


 Understanding of accounting principles and financial analysis


 Typically 4 years of experience as a financial analyst

Senior Pricing Analyst
======================

[Hewlett Packard](https://in.indeed.com/cmp/HP?campaignid=mobvjcmp&from=mobviewjob&tk=1hu8ap4b2jv5m800&fromjk=231d60a513b501a4)4.0 out of 5Bengaluru, Karnataka[Hewlett Packard

--------

Bengaluru, Karnataka Full job description
--------------------


We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Pricing Analyst to join our team. As a Senior Pricing Analyst, you will play a key role in developing and executing pricing strategies, conducting pricing analysis, and providing actionable insights to optimize profitability and drive revenue growth. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in pricing analytics, exceptional data analysis skills, and a deep understanding of pricing methodologies and strategies.


 If you are passionate about pricing, data science, and driving business growth through strategic pricing initiatives, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and contribute to shaping our global pricing strategies and data-driven decision-making processes.


 *Responsibilities*


* Pricing Analysis: Conduct a comprehensive pricing analysis to assess market trends, competitive dynamics, and customer behaviors. Utilize data-driven insights to identify pricing opportunities, evaluate pricing effectiveness, and recommend pricing adjustments to maximize profitability.
* Pricing Strategy: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and refine pricing strategies aligned with business objectives. Provide inputs and recommendations for pricing decisions, considering factors such as cost structures, competitive positioning, and customer value perception.
* Data Management: Collect, organize, and validate pricing data from multiple sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency. Develop and maintain pricing databases, dashboards, and reports to enable effective monitoring and analysis of pricing performance.
* Pricing Optimization: Use advanced statistical analysis techniques and predictive modeling to identify pricing optimization opportunities. Develop and deploy pricing models and simulations to assess the impact of pricing changes on revenue and margin.
* Competitive Intelligence: Monitor and analyze competitor pricing strategies and market dynamics. Provide regular updates and insights to key stakeholders to facilitate informed decision-making and maintain competitive advantage.
* Pricing Governance: Establish and maintain pricing governance processes, including pricing policies, guidelines, and approval workflows. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal pricing guidelines.
* Model Development : Hands on experience in building price elasticity models
* Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate closely with sales, marketing, finance, and product teams to gather inputs, share insights, and align pricing strategies with overall business objectives. Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
* Visualization: Create and report KPI insights in Tableau/Power BI
* Manages and creates relationships with business partners to evaluate and foster data-driven innovation, and provide domain-specific expertise in cross-organization projects/initiatives.
* Communicating business value and innovation potential through effective insights/visualizations.
* Leverages recognized domain expertise, business acumen, and overall data systems leadership to influence decisions of executive business leadership, development partners, and industry standards groups.


 *Knowledge & Skills*


* Master's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience as a pricing analyst or similar role, preferably in an eCommerce B2C environment.
* Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis and statistical modeling techniques.
* Proficiency in using tools such as Excel, SQL, and business intelligence platforms for data manipulation and analysis.
* Solid understanding of pricing methodologies, concepts, and strategies.
* Familiarity with pricing software and tools is a plus (e.g., pricing optimization software, and revenue management systems).
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
* Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
* Experience in the industry sector related to the position (e.g., retail, e-commerce, manufacturing) is advantageous.
* Demonstrated innovation in the domain
* Fluent in structured and unstructured data, its management, and modern data transformation methodologies.
* Effectively and creatively tell stories and create visualizations to describe and communicate data insights.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.
* Ability to effectively communicate data product architectures and/or algorithm design proposals and negotiate options at senior management levels, BU and executive levels.


 *Scope & Impact*


* Collaborates with peers, junior engineers, data scientists and project team.
* Typically interacts with high- level Individual Contributors, Managers, Directors and Program Core Teams.
* Leads multiple projects requiring data engineering solutions development.
* Drives design innovation.


 *Education & Experience*


* Bachelor's, Master's or PHD degree in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, or equivalent.
* Typically 10+ years’ experience including graduate or postgraduate research.

--------

Bengaluru, Karnataka Full job description
--------------------



Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.





**About this Program**
----------------------




 **Objective**: To apply rich knowledge and research mindset and empower them to build rewarding and satisfying careers in the fields of transport and infrastructure.  
 **Structure:** Paid program of nine-month duration  
 **Eligibility:** PhD Scholars registered with any university in India or abroad in a relevant academic discipline, currently employed or doing projects in specifically identified areas (Currently pursuing PhD).  
 **Place of Work:** Bangalore



 **About the function:**


 Electro-mobility is one of the focus areas within Volvo Group, which is at the forefront of sustainable transport solutions for tomorrow. Also, we are providing world-class solutions for electro-mobility systems and delivering customer values for Volvo business units such as trucks, buses, construction equipment and marine applications.


 We at EMOB Data Analytics team focus on data driven development and look to create opportunities for services.


 You will have close cross-functional collaboration with colleagues from different parts of Technology Organization. You along with the team will be responsible for understanding customer usage and performance of our products and for providing solutions throughout the entire product life cycle.






**Who are you?**
----------------





  
 We believe that to be successful in the position, you are a team player, have strong understanding in Data Science and proficient in Electro-mobility systems.


 You have great appetite for learning and adding value, with high level ownership.


 You are highly skilled in tools like Power BI, SQL and Python.






  
 We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.



 **Who we are and what we believe in**  
 Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.



  
 Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.



 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

**PRIMARY FUNCTION**


  
 Sr Financial planning and analysis (FP&A) team compiles and analyzes an organization's long-term financial strategy. In addition to creating financial plan and forecasts, FP&A team also generates reports, analyzes financial trends, calculate the effects of business decisions and advise company leaders.



 Target India FP&A team supports Target’s operational areas which includes Merchandising Finance, Supply Chain Finance, Digital Finance and Target India Finance teams. This position requires strong analytical, communication, management and strategic thinking skills and ability to partner with senior stakeholders in multiple functions to develop business insights and analytics.



 **PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**



* Key responsibility will be to work with different teams within FP&A / Finance to draw out key insights / drive new analytics around different areas of the business
* Build a deep understanding of the business and a broader understanding of its role in the company
* Management reporting (Business Review Reports and Decks / Variance Analysis / Operational Analysis etc.) with detailed commentary and analysis
* Analyze business performance and support decision making by providing stakeholders with meaningful insights and visibility on business performance on a regular basis
* Generate insights into business performance to help drive improve financial results and facilitate data-based decision making
* Assist in preparing Operating Plan / Budgets and forecasts / outlook
* Use data extraction tools like SQL, Hadoop to extract and manipulate large amounts of data
* Build scenarios, plug and play models, what if analysis to simulate the financial impacts of various operational decisions
* Automate routine reports and processes using VBA / Macros / Automation Portal
* Build self-serving dashboards for business teams to quickly obtain and assess data


 **REPORTING/WORKING RELATIONSHIPS**



* Reports to Senior Manager, FP&A (Target India)
* Partner with Finance teams in India
* Partner with Global FP&A teams based out of Minneapolis



 **JOB REQUIREMENTS**



* Commerce/ Accounting / Engineering / Management (MBA’s) / Data Analytics backgrounds preferred but not mandatory
* 5+years of experience
* Prior experience in FP&A / Data Analytics in large organizations
* Strong presentation and business storytelling skills
* Detail-oriented
* Ability to multi-task
* Team collaboration skills
* Good business acumen
* Proficiency in Advanced Excel, SQL and Data Visualization tools like DOMO, Tableau, Power BI
* Prior experience in Consumer facing / Retail industries is preferred but not mandatory



 **JOB DETAILS**


* Team Member Type – Regular
* Job Title – Sr. Financial Analyst FP&A
* Time Type – Full time
* Location – Bangalore9374 Target India Manyata (D4)

Bengaluru, Karnataka Full job description

**What’s in it For You:** 


* The opportunity to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, and healthy environments.
* The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth.
* The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our best.



 **What You Will Do:** 


* As part of the SAP QA Testing team, you will partner with business users and SMEs to identify end-to-end SAP Supply Chain functional and business process test steps, requirements, data, and obtain business approvals.
* Work closely with team members from other SAP functions as needed to assist in identifying end-to-end test steps and data.
* You will also participate in manual regression testing for enterprise SAP projects.
* Work closely with automation engineers to automate SAP tests.
* Gather requirements from the business to identify what test data is needed and translate those requirements into an overall data strategy to identify or create test data at the beginning of testing cycles.
* Create and/or provide automation run reports to the business for review and approval.
* You may also work with the support team to:


 o Develop complex requirements for process or system solutions within the business domain, based on given business requirements.


 o Identify and clearly document business, functional, and non-functional requirements.


 o Maintain expert product knowledge and use an analytical approach to find best practice solutions and opportunities for improvement.


 o Perform root cause analysis for major issues.


 o Develop and execute plans and organize work to ensure efficient delivery of results to meet business expectations.


 o Coordinate collaboration between the business users, other support teams and the technical team to ensure seamless support to the customer.


 o Provide analysis and hands-on support for system upgrades and technical improvements, coordinating with the development and technical teams.


 o Collaborate with the technical teams (e.g., ABAP, SAP Security, SAP Basis, SAP DB support, etc.) to perform various activities required to resolve the incidents, perform the root cause analysis (RCA), tune and improve the system performance, etc.


 Utilize your functional and technical (ABAP) skills to debug and independently analyze to provide optimal SAP solutions.




 Minimum Qualifications:
   

* Bachelor’s Degree in IT/related discipline and/or equivalent SAP certifications.
* 7-11 years of support, configuration, and testing experience in SAP modules that support the Supply Chain Logistics value stream with the core competencies listed below:

 o Core SAP Supply Chain Logistics Competencies Required:
   
  Supply Chain Logistics Management.
   

* Warehousing: Efficient management of goods across warehouses, fulfillment centers, and distribution networks.
* Fulfillment: Streamlining order processing, packing, and shipping.
* Distribution: Optimize delivery routes and ensure timely product distribution.
* Inventory Management: Tracking of stock levels, goods movements, and inventory accuracy.

  Materials Management.
   

* Procurement: Handling of purchasing activities like requisition creation, sourcing, vendor management, and purchase order processing.
* Inventory Management: Tracking and management of inventory levels, including material master data, forecasting, planning, stock valuation, and inventory control activities.

  Transportation Management.
   

* Transport Planning: Efficient planning and optimization of transportation routes.
* Freight Booking and Execution: Execution of transportation orders, track shipments, and manage carriers.
* Freight Cost Management: Monitoring of transportation costs and settle freight charges.
* Freight planning and execution: Planning and execution of transportation activities, including route optimization, carrier selection, freight booking, and shipment tracking.
* Customs management: Management of customs documentation and processes for import and export activities.

  Warehouse Management.
   

* Warehouse Operations: Management of inbound and outbound goods movements, picking, packing, putaway, cross-docking, inventory management within the warehouse, cycle counting, and returns processing.
* Warehouse Configuration: Defining warehouse layout, storage bin and zone management, picking and putaway strategies, and warehouse activity types.

  Sales and Distribution.
   

* Delivery execution: Creation of delivery documents, schedules deliveries, and tracks shipment status.

  Extended Warehouse Management.
   

* Advanced Warehousing: Provisioning of features like slotting, cross-docking, and wave picking.
* Labor Management: Optimization of workforce productivity within warehouses.
* Yard Logistics: Management of yard operations, including truck arrivals and departures.
* Seamless integration of warehouse operations with transportation planning.
* Facilitation of collaboration with carriers and logistics partners.

  “Overall” Value Stream.
   

* End-to-end visibility and control: Provisioning of real-time visibility into the entire supply chain, from procurement to delivery, enabling informed decision-making.
* Improved efficiency and cost reduction: Optimization of logistics processes, reduces inefficiencies, and minimizes transportation costs.
* Enhanced customer satisfaction: Enablement of on-time deliveries and improved customer service through accurate order fulfillment.
* Increased agility and resilience: Provisioning of tools and insights to adapt to disruptions and ensure business continuity.

  Production Planning.
   

* Production supply planning.
* Finished goods delivery.

  Quality Management.
   

* Quality checks during logistics processes.
* Compliance with quality standards.

 o Core SAP Supply Chain Logistics Competencies for Integration with Other SAP Modules Required:
   
  Sales and Distribution.
   

* Stock availability for sales orders.
* Order processing and goods delivery.

  Materials Management.
   

* Procurement of spare parts and materials for logistics operations.
* Validation of material availability during execution.

  Finance.
   

* Integration with FI to record financial transactions related to logistics activities, such as purchase orders, freight charges, and customs duties.
* Provision data for cost analysis of logistics activities, like transportation costs and inventory carrying costs.
* Experience of working with SAP Security process (and the use of FFID) and find, test, and implement SAP OSS request/notes for given incidents and issues resolution.
* Experience of working with various middleware technologies and solutions, within and outside of SAP.
* Experience of working with creating, modifying, scheduling, and monitoring SAP Supply Chain Logistics related jobs and job plans in a global environment using jobs scheduling tools and applications.
* Experience with minimum 2 full SAP implementations in the Supply Chain Logistics space, preferably at least 1 with S/4HANA.
* Experience of independently debugging ABAP codes to find solutions.
* Working knowledge of ITIL Incident, Problem, and Change Management methodologies.
* Experience working on multiple projects and meeting project goals on time.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to maintain critical thinking while balancing multiple tasks.
* Ability to work well within a team, focusing on building relationships with all project stakeholders.
* Proven ability to learn new skills, technologies, and is passionate about conveying knowledge.
* Understand business needs, build strategic partnerships, and document and implement software solutions.
* Experience with pricing, IDOCs, and Integrations.
* Good knowledge of Open Text ALM and how to use it for testing purposes




 **Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**  
   
 Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.
 

  

  



 The CCB Data & Analytics team responsibly leverages data across Chase to build competitive advantages for the businesses while providing value and protection for customers. The team encompasses a variety of disciplines from data governance and strategy to reporting, data science and machine learning. **The Opportunity**



  
 Sitetracker is looking for a Solution Analyst to assist in implementing the Sitetracker product for new
 

 customers. You will work closely with our Solution Architects to identify requirements and find
 

 creative solutions to tailor our product to our customers’ business process.
 


  
 Overall, the position incorporates product configuration, data analysis, project management, and
 

 development as needed. Solution Analysts are given a great opportunity for advancement and
 

 leadership placement in a rapidly growing environment.
 




### **The Skill Set:**


+ Experience with Salesforce.com configuration. Should have strong hands-on experience on formula fields, reports & dashboard, flows, security settings, custom level, custom metadata, portal environment setup, package installation and org setup etc.
+ Has built data model using relational database knowledge to capture customers business requirements.
+ Advanced Excel skills, can evidence skills in Vlookups, formulas, pivot table etc to transform data and create reports.
+ Committed to meet project deadlines and delivering quality work.
+ Maintain composure in stressful situations, respond to customer needs quickly, and effectively adapt to change.
+ Communicate complex concepts to clients and document complex requirements in an easily digestible format that shows you understand the customer’s business needs.
+ Good at listening and can evidence asking questions that dive deeper into requirements or in identifying the root problem.
+ Demonstrate proficiency working in a fast-paced environment and excels at multitasking across complex projects.






### **Within 60 Days, You'll:**


+ Have a good understanding of the Sitetracker product
+ Create reports and dashboards to visualize Sitetracker data
+ Analyze source data and perform data loading.
+ Participate in customer meetings and support the Solution Architects during the meeting.
+ Configure Sitetracker modules to meet customer needs
+ Work with your manager to understand and apply Sitetracker implementation methodology.
+ Collaborate with other team to submit product enhancements and bugs






### **Within 180 Days, You'll:**


+ Develop technical solution from customer business requirements
+ Manage time and prioritization to support multiple projects implementation and meet the project timeline.
+ Participate actively in customer meetings and lead discussion for specific activity e.g. UAT Support.
+ Be able to apply standard Salesforce features as a solution to meet customer requirements.
+ Participate actively to define specific process flow from customer’s business requirement and write down the corresponding user stories






### **Within 365 Days, You'll:**


+ Lead end-to-end small (utilizing standard Sitetracker capabilities) customer engagements
+ Work closely with Senior Architect to design custom solutions based on customer requirements while leveraging Salesforce best practices.
+ Independently present standard Sitetracker Business Process flow as part of customer engagement
+ Independently preparing user stories based on the business process flow and present it to the customer
+ Prepare and confidently present technical documents in customer calls.
+ Follow all Sitetracker’s standards as defined in the Sitetracker standard methodology within the assigned projects
+ Train new specialists on Sitetracker implementation methodologies and technical concepts.
+ Successfully completed a customer implementation with metrics to support







 **About Sitetracker**




 Sitetracker was founded ten years ago with the singular focus of solving a problem that was first recognized within the telecommunications industry; how to effectively manage the volume, variety, and velocity of critical infrastructure projects needed to meet the demand of expanding wireless and cellular service. That problem has become even more pronounced due to the eventual explosion of 5G. Being able to effectively deploy infrastructure is going to be the differentiator between leading telecommunication providers. 
 



 However, over the years, we realized that this challenge isn’t localized to telecommunications – it’s pervasive nearly everywhere and has reached an inflection point. Utilities (such as gas and electric services), smart cities, and alternative energy all face similar challenges. Sitetracker is the only full-lifecycle project management platform suited to support these companies and address these challenges.
 



 We are exceptionally proud of the company we’ve built (we were recently recognized as the #2 place to work in San Francisco, as well as one of the top places to work in the entire United States). Our people are extraordinary and we’re continuing to invest in our people-first culture.
